newsitem.title: USA: US Justice Dept says reviewing Microsoft purchases.
newsitem.headline: US Justice Dept says reviewing Microsoft purchases.

text.p: The U.S. Justice Department's antitrust division is reviewing Microsoft Corp's purchases in the video streaming market, a department spokeswoman said Monday.
"We're looking at the proposed transactions," Gina Talamona, a spokeswoman for the antitrust division, told Reuters.

Talamona confirmed that the Justice Department was reviewing Microsoft's acquisition of VXtreme Inc, a Silicon Valley developer of technology for sending audio and video over the Internet, as well as an earlier deal to buy a 10 percent stake Progressive Networks Inc, in a plan aimed at unifying standards for delivering audio and video.
She also confirmed an antitrust review of Microsoft's investment in VDOnet, the developer of a technology that overcomes key limitations now constraining Internet communications.
In addition, Talamona noted that the Justice Department is looking into the deal announced August 6 in which Microsoft announced it would invest $150 million in former arch-rival Apple Computer Inc.
